body.name: Learning Resources STEM Explorers Bridge Builders - STEM Toys and Kits for Kids Ages 5+, STEM Learning Games,Stocking Stuffers for Kids
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
features: Solve STEM Challenges: Kids design, construct, and test their own bridges and towers as they solve this STEM building toy’s 9 STEM challenges!

Inspired By Real-World Engineering: From suspension bridges to beam bridges and every structure in between, this STEM kit’s challenges introduce kids to the fundamental principles of structural engineering.
Build Critical Thinking Skills: As they test and tweak their designs, kids will also use this STEM building toy to build essential critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ages and Skills: Specially designed with little ones in mind, this STEM toy for kids helps kids as young as 5 build essential early engineering skills!

Give the Gift of Learning: Whether you’re shopping for holidays, birthdays, or just because, award-winning educational toys from Learning Resources help you discover new learning fun every time you give a gift!
Toy of the Year 2023 Finalist - Construction Toy of the Year.
Kids' Toys for Stocking Stuffers!: From fidget toys and board games to puzzles and beyond, our education Kids toys make the perfect Christmas gifts for boys and girls!
body.description: Put your STEM skills to the ultimate engineering test! Kids design, construct, and test their bridges and towers as they solve the STEM challenges found in the STEM Explorers Bridge Builders set from Learning Resources. Inspired by real-world structural engineering, this STEM building toy’s 9 STEM challenges help kids learn the fundamental design principles of all kinds of bridges—use real-world techniques to build and test your own beam bridge, suspension bridge, and more! As they test and tweak their STEM kit creations, kids will also hone the critical thinking and problem solving skills that are essential to STEM success. This 62-piece STEM building toy includes all of the platforms, columns, and connectors needed to build bridges and towers, as well as 10 activity cards packed with challenges. Science. Technology. Engineering. Mathematics. STEM help us bring the future home today. That's why Learning Resources is dedicated to helping kids get an early start on these essential skills. From building sets grounded in the fundamentals of engineering to coding robots designed for kids as young as 4, our award-winning educational toys unlock the 21st-century STEM skills they need to succeed today and tomorrow. Made from durable, BPA-free plastic, our STEM toys for kids are ready for years of learning fun at home or in the classroom. We're Learning Resources, and learning is where we play. With nearly 40 years of experience, our family-owned company’s mission is founded on offering kids educational toys for infinite inspiration to succeed in school and beyond. From ABCs and 123s to fine motor and STEM, our award-winning educational toys help kids discover countless ways to develop a lifelong love of learning while they build new skills. In 2022, Learning Resources expanded this dedication to learning and enrichment with Brightkins, a line of interactive pet training tools and toys that help families discover bright ways for pets to play! Learn more about how we turn a childhood love of play into a lifelong love of learning with a visit to our brand store today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughter LOVED this project! The directions were color coded and she followed along nicely. We made magnetic castles and helped bridge the gap between the two building!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My nephew loved this as he is scientifically minded. Highly recommend for smart kiddos!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice STEM building toy, but limited in capturing interest
reviews.reviewText: My son loves "building" toys and STEM toys in general. He did like this one as well but overall judging from his interest levels not as much as others that are more attractive (like spaceships, etc). I guess because this one in contrast appears a bit drab since it just has bridges. But engineering is like that as well :). It probably combines well with other toys from this manufacturer. The toy itself is well-made and has bright colors. The instruction cards are not much to speak of with just a picture but that was enough for my son (who is 5) to build several of the models. I like that it has a picture of an actual bridge of the type that they will build. I'm not a civil engineer but I think some of the mechanics of attaching the pieces are also "scientific" in the sense they have something similar to the real-world building of that bridge. I think overall this is a different but nice set to have in a kid's collection. Most other building toys are cities or space ships or buildings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun lit and learning
reviews.reviewText: Great bridge building kit. Great learning experience to

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Son loves it.
reviews.reviewText: Not too much to put. Son loves it. Great STEM toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set For Little Engineers
reviews.reviewText: My daughter who is 5, has enjoyed this set so much. It has given her hours of entertainment. Well thought out and great quality. I would definitely order it again. I think it’s fairly priced for the quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my 5 year old but I will say the bridge designing is hard for her to do on her own. I did them all with her and explained the differences between the bridges. Overall it’s educational and would be a great as an additional tool to a bridge lesson, especially for older kids. I would think this would be best for kids 7-10, for them to follow the directions themselves.We did enjoy it and now she is playing with it alone so I call it a win.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Overall I think that this is a fun building set and is great to mix it up and do something different than typical building sets that I have seen. I like that there are different cards with different things you can build, and you can also just ad-lib it and make your own creation. The backsides of the cards also have other languages. My almost 4 year old and I had fun with it for a little while until she said it was boring and she didn't want to play anymore, lol. I don't think this kit is boring (I had fun with it), but I do think that she is too young to really get the point of it and to enjoy it to its full extent. It says for ages 5+ and I'd say that for the average kiddo they should be at least 5 for this.My only issue is that the large square pieces are super hard to snap together and to pull apart. In addition to that, it seems to be straining the female connectors on the pieces when they are going together and coming apart and I wonder if there will be any issues over time when they are put together and pulled apart enough times. On the other hand, you don't have to worry about them falling apart when you have your structures together.
Got a Xmas present for my nephew, he loved it. Very good quality and very creative toy for five plus years kids

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a wonderful toy to develop my daughter's spacial awareness and building skills. I was truly fascinating by it, every little girl should have the opportunity to play with this toy if we want to beat the STEM gender gap. Clear instructions, she required a bit of help from me but she was so proud of her creation in the end. Amazinf

reviews.reviewTitle: Juego de estimulación cognitiva a partir de los 5 años
reviews.reviewText: Learning Resources es una de mis marcas de referencia en cuanto a juguetes educativos se refiere, por la sencillez en su diseño, precio y propiedades que hacen que los más pequeños de la casa desarrollen sin pretenderlo, sus habilidades latentes o potenciales.En este caso la marca nos ofrece un set de construcción de puentes que consta de 9 tarjetas cuyas instrucciones deberemos seguir y que son de dificultad creciente.Un juego que se engloba dentro de los llamados STEM, que provienen del inglés y quieren decir Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, lo que en español viene a significar ciencia, tecnología, ingeniería y matemáticas.Un juego que es ideal para estimular a los más pequeños a nivel cognitivo, para que trabajen la psicomotricidad fina y la coordinación óculo manual, para niños a partir de los 5 años.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Got this for our nephew we often look after - he loves playing with it when he comes to stay, and has taught me how to use/play with it (with a little help). For enjoyment alone top marks!

Se trata de un juego de la marca conocida Learning Resources.El juego propone 9 pruebas que tienen que resolver de Stem. El juego consiste en unir las piezas y conseguir que se aguanten las diferentes estructuras que proponen las 10 tarjetas que vienen en el juego.Me ha gustado mucho este juego porque permite adquirir habilidades para resolver problemas.
